cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or other unpredictable behavior.
explanation: The code iterates 'size' times, accessing 'old[i]' in each iteration. If the 'size' parameter, which dictates the loop's upper bound, is larger than the actual allocated or valid size of the 'old' array/buffer, an out-of-bounds read will occur. This can lead to crashes (denial of service) or information disclosure by reading data from adjacent memory locations. The function does not perform any bounds checking on the 'old' array based on the provided 'size'.
